CDC urges local govâ€™t bodies to put disaster response systems, training into action
newsroomgy

The Civil Defence Commission (CDC) is re-emphasizing the responsibility of Neighbourhood Democratic Councils, Community Development Councils, Village Councils and Regional Democratic Councils in conducting assessments and reporting and providing support to residents affected by floods and other natural hazards.

Continuous flooding in communities across Guyana has reinforced the need for these bodies to utilise the training and plans provided by the CDC over the years.

The CDC, with support from the UNDP and IDB was able to improve the National Disaster Risk Management System (DRM) which has the Regional Disaster Risk Management Systems as critical components. This allowed each region to develop its own DRM system in keeping with the wider national mechanism. Plans and systems have been developed and implemented in all ten administrative regions.

Heavy downpours and floods wreaked havoc in New Zealand's South Island, causing waterlogging, damaging homes, power cuts and uprooting hundreds of trees. The rising water of all rivers crossed danger mark in some eastern areas of Christchurch. Authorities ordered to close schools and colleges due to the flooding risk. More than 1,000 homes remained out of power across Christchurch. The administration declared a state of local emergency for the whole Canterbury region of the South Island. People have been advised to stay at home to avoid road closure and flooding risks. Red level warnings in the country were "issued for the most extreme weather systems which may cause widespread disruption and severe impacts," according to MetService.

Cracked downspout? 
We have an easy solution for you! 

Downspouts play a key role in diverting precipitation away from your property. Functional downspouts are essential in protecting your property from water damage.

A typical winter problem that affects downspouts is ice accumulation. This happens when there are obstructions in the gutters that slow down the water flow or if the downspout's mouth is blocked by heavy snowfall. 

It is essential to detach the flex spout extensions around all of your downspouts during the winter months. It is common for water to freeze inside the flex, which can cause further damage to the downspouts. If left untreated, this will result in water seepage inside your home. 

Visit www.lemarg.ca for all your emergency needs. 
or reach out to us at 1.855.7LEMARG
